attributes.title: Physical Stock Verification.
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Physical stock take of all the items at the branch was done on 11/04/2025. The aim was to assess the strength/weakness of internal control systems put in place. Significant variances in stock items would be interpreted as a threat to the safety of the company’s items and vice versa.

·       Notable discrepancies were observed in the following categories:

·       Aggregate bread difference was Excess of 17 pcs (White Bread) and shortfall of 12 Pcs (Brown Bread).

·       Aggregated polybags difference was Excess of 365pcs.

·       Utto difference was shortfall of 0.25Kgs.

The table below illustrates the findings:

Implications

Minimal stock variances imply strong controls
attributes.recommendation: · Strong controls on Stocks should be adhered to in order to minimize the variances.

value:
·  Bread variance was within limits.

The current tins at the branch use more Utto, resulting in a shortfall in Utto during stock take.

·  Bread stock variance is within the acceptable limit.

Damaged polybags from packers and employees were added leading to excess polybags.

·  In the prior audit report highlighted variations during physical stock verification on.

ü  Packing Materials: Variance of -173 pieces.

ü  Bread Stock: Variance of - 20 pieces.

Utto -2.6Kg
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Standard Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Packed bread samples were weighed on 11/04/2025 to establish if product released to the market was of the desired quantity.

·       From the selected sample 400g WB - 19% and 200 WB - 08% were found to be underweight.

The table below summarizes the findings

Implications.

The presence of underweight bread expose the company to non-compliance issues.
attributes.recommendation: Strict adherence to set standard dough weights in order to attain standard weight bread.

value: Bread weight is within the required limit.
I will do a follow up to ensure the required standard weight is achieved.

In the prior audit,  underweight were noted in

ü  400g WB: 05% underweight

200g WB: 09% underweight.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       An analysis of mixing charts and summaries was done to determine if the raw materials usage were as per the set BOM and if the set production standards were achieved.

·       An analysis was also performed to verify if there were any significant variances between the mixing chart summary and the SAP system.

Implication

·       The Average yield was within the set target.

·       Production target was not met, and this revenue was not realized.

·       Minor variances between Mixing chart and SAP is an indication of good controls.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should work towards achieving the set production target and set consumption standards.

value:
·       We produce as per orders and transfers requested. However, we will work toward achieving the set production target.

Moving forward there will be no cutting down production.
The production target is achievable; however, cutting down production led to not meeting the set target.

·        In the prior audit, Physical and system material usage was matching

No variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Production and Market Damages
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Production and market damages were analyzed to determine their rate during production or from market and compare the same with the allowed standards. High production damage rate would suggest product of inferior quality was allowed to the market.

·       Allowed production damages rate is 0.25% of total production and market damage is 0.2% of net sales.

·       Production and market damage rate was analyzed from cash flow date 07/03/2025 - 10/04/2025.

·       It was observed that  production and market damages were within the established limits,  as illustrated below;

Implications

Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that
attributes.recommendation: To adhere to the set quality control parameters within the production process to minimize production damages.

value: To be maintained
We will maintain control production and market damages.
In the prior audit, the production damage was 0.23%, while market damages remained within the set limit at 0.20%.
Previous

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
1.     Packing Efficiency

Findings.

·       Packing efficiencies were analyzed from 07/03/25 – 10/04/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

·       Actual packing efficiency was 92.2 crates per packer which is slightly below the set limit.

Below is a summary table of the findings

Packing efficiency

Implications

Failing to achieve the set target the company have incurred extract cost of Ksh.17, 328.
attributes.recommendation: The branch manager should conduct a review of whether the 19 additional slicers were truly necessary to achieve 95% efficiency.

value: Packing Efficiency was affected by cutting down production.
Cutting down the production affected the efficiency.
In the prior audit, the packing efficiency was 94.5 Crates.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings.

·  Production efficiencies were analyzed from 07/03/25 – 10/04/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

·  Actual production efficiency was 4.39 bags per worker which is slightly below the set limit.

Below is a summary table of the findings

Production efficiency

Implication

The Production efficiency was slightly below the KPI. This implies extra cost of KES 13,039 was incurred to hire extra production workers.
attributes.recommendation: Continue to monitor production efficiency regularly.

value: · We are working to towards achieving the set target. However, moving forward there will be no cutting down production.
·       The production Efficiency was slightly below the KPI due to cutting down production.
In the previous audit, the production efficiency was 4.41 bags.
Previous

attributes.title: Physical Cash Verification and Cash Handling
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Physical cash was verified on 11/04/2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

Implications.

Cash loss risk is minimal. This imply strong controls.
attributes.recommendation: Observed cash control is commendable.

value: The cash controls are effective and will be maintained.
Cash controls are effective.
In the prior audit report, No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

· An analysis of the debt balance as at 14/04/2025 was performed to identify any occurrences of bad debts or unresolved balances by route.

· During the audit, it was noted that there were no balances.

Implication

No significant issues were identified in the debtor balances.
attributes.recommendation: · The sales and operations teams should continue maintaining effective controls over debtors.

value: ·  To be maintained.
We will maintain debtor’s controls.
No previous findings.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mileage Analysis
attributes.recommendation: It is recommended to continue monitoring fuel consumption closely.

value: Strong controls to be maintained.
The consumption is within the set standard rate.
No previous audit findings.
Previous

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description:
Findings.

· A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 14/04/2025 to assess whether the operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.

· The physical quantities of various varieties were compared to the DDS balance, and the variance was calculated to identify any discrepancies.

· It was noted that there were no variances between the physical quantities and the DDS balances for all the minishops i.e. Bamburi 2, Bakarani, and Bamburi Stage except from Kisauni that had a crates shortfall of 13.

Implications:

A shortfall of crates at Minishops implies controls are not effective.
attributes.recommendation: The controls on crates at Minishops should be strengthened.

value: Kisauni crates shortfall will be recovered from the Minishop attendant
·       Follow up will be made.
No previous findings.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Fuel Consumption (Generator)
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Fuel consumption tests were carried out to determine if set consumption standards for sales vans were adhered to.

·       Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 28l/hr.

·       Generator fuel consumption from 01/04/2025 – 11/04/2025 is analyzed on the below table.

Implication

The generator consumption was within the set standards. The 25.41 liters per hour is lower than the expected rate, it indicates fuel savings.
attributes.recommendation: ·       Economical fuel consumption by the generator is commendable.

value: Effective controls will be maintained.
The generator fuel consumption is economical.

·    In the prior audit report, the average fuel consumption rate was 22.75 litres per hour which is within the range.

·   No significant variation between physical records and the system records.
Previous
Operations/Production Department
